intro: Hieracium chordosum var. luculentum, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring yellow flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are usually reddish and covered in fine hairs. This variety is notable for its bright, showy inflorescences and is often found in meadows and grassy areas.
